intro: Audibertiella polystachya, commonly known as the red-stemmed thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its upright, spiny stems and purple to pinkish flowers that bloom in dense, terminal clusters. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Audibertiella polystachya is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
